metadata.title: CVE-2019-19448 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21 and 5.3.11, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystemimage, performing some operations, and then making a syncfs system call canlead to a use-after-free in try_merge_free_space infs/btrfs/free-space-cache.c because the pointer to a left data structurecan be the same as the pointer to a right data structure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1139.148
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1143-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1143.152
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-190.220').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1080.87').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1114.127').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1086.98~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.148').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.152').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
